required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study About Nutritional Support of Enhanced Protein in Critical Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Randomized Controlled Clinical Study With WeiYuan Tai (a Nutritional Supplement) on Nutritional Support of Enhanced Protein in Severe Patients(Tai Shan)

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Dalian Medical University
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Dalian Medical University
First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University
The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective randomized controlled trial. 180 patients with critical illness will be included and randomly divided into two groups. In the control group, patients will be fed with basic energy; and in the experiment group, the patients will be given extra protein intake except the basic energy intake. The intervention duration will last 6 days. The primary outcomes of this study are urea nitrogen of 24h and prealbumin(PA). And other outcomes include nutritional status, safety indicators and clinical indicators.

detailed_description.textblock: Critical illness patients are commonly in the risk of malnutrition, because of various factors. And nutritional supplement, particularly the supplement of protein, can decrease the nitrogen balance, improve the nutritional status, accelerate the speed of healing and decrease the mortality rate. This is a multi center prospective randomized controlled trial. 180 patients with critical illness will be included and randomly divided into two groups. In the control group, patients will be fed with basic energy; and in the experiment group, the patients will be given extra protein intake except the basic energy intake. The intervention duration will last 6 days. The primary outcomes of this study are urea nitrogen of 24h and prealbumin(PA). And other outcomes include nutritional status(total protein, albumin, grip and calf circumference), safety indicators(liver function, kidney function, tolerance, etc.) and clinical indicators(overall complication rate, length of hospital stay and cost).

primary_outcome.description: the total amount of urea nitrogen in 24 hours
the level of prealbumin in blood

secondary_outcome.description: the total protein level in blood
the level of albumin in blood

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline calf circumference at 6 days
change from baseline grip at 6 days
secondary_outcome.description: the strength(force measured kilograms) of the right hand measured by a hand-held dynamometer (if the right hand is not impossible, the left is ok )

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the day receiving enteral nutrition to day6
secondary_outcome.description: the over complication rate after receiving enteral nutrition

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of admission in the hospital until the date of discharge, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: the overall time stay in hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from date of admission in the hospital until the date of discharge, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: all the money paid in the hospital
the level of AST/ALT in blood
the level of creatinine in blood

arm_group.description: Patients will be given basic energy intake according to their weight, and will be extra maltodextrin as the placebo
Patients will be given basic energy intake according to their weight, and will be extra protein intake

intervention.intervention_name: a production consist of various oligopeptides and the whey protein
intervention.description: patients will be given extra protein intake except the basic energy intake
used as placebo in the control group

results_reference.citation: Singer P, Blaser AR, Berger MM, Alhazzani W, Calder PC, Casaer MP, Hiesmayr M, Mayer K, Montejo JC, Pichard C, Preiser JC, van Zanten ARH, Oczkowski S, Szczeklik W, Bischoff SC. ESPEN guideline on clinical nutrition in the intensive care unit. Clin Nutr. 2019 Feb;38(1):48-79. doi: 10.1016/j.clnu.2018.08.037. Epub 2018 Sep 29.

Arabi YM, Al-Dorzi HM, Mehta S, Tamim HM, Haddad SH, Jones G, McIntyre L, Solaiman O, Sakkijha MH, Sadat M, Afesh L, Kumar A, Bagshaw SM, Aldawood AS; PermiT Trial Group. Association of protein intake with the outcomes of critically ill patients: a post hoc analysis of the PermiT trial. Am J Clin Nutr. 2018 Nov 1;108(5):988-996. doi: 10.1093/ajcn/nqy189.

patient_data.ipd_description: The following data will be shared at the end of the study: demographic data, other baseline data of patients and date of outcomes collected at this research
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The data is expected to be available after, December, 2020 and can be used forever
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The information should be used for academic research, medical communication, etc., and is prohibited from being used for commercial gain.
